title: How to Boil a Hot Dog Using a Microwave or Stove

steps.title: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil.
steps.content: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil. Choose a pot that's large enough to fit all the hot dogs you want to boil. Leave a few inches of room at the top of the pot so it won't boil over when you add the dogs.

steps.title: Place the hot dogs in the pot.
steps.content: Place the hot dogs in the pot. Carefully slip them into the pot one by one. Don't toss them in all at once, or the boiling water could splash you. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Boil the hot dogs for 6 minutes.
steps.content: Boil the hot dogs for 6 minutes. Cooking your Frankfurt for 6 minutes is long enough to get them piping hot but short enough to keep them from splitting down the middle. Avoid letting the hot dogs split, since they'll lose a lot of flavor if they do. If you're boiling a large pack of hot dogs, they may need extra cooking time. Test a dog by making a small center slit to see whether it steams. If not, continue cooking for another minute or two. [2] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source If you're boiling just a dog or two, they may be ready before six minutes are up. Test a dog at five minutes by making a small slit to see whether it steams. If not, put it back in the water. [3] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source

steps.title: Remove the hot dogs from heat and drain them.
steps.content: Remove the hot dogs from heat and drain them. Pour the entire pot of dogs through a colander to drain the water. Or, you can remove them one at a time with tongs, shaking off the water as you go. [4] X Research source If you made enough hot dogs for people to come back for seconds, leave the extra dogs in the pot of warm water. Put a lid on the pot and move it to a cool burner; the extra dogs are still likely to be hot when you're ready to eat them. If you've set up a hot dog bar and you're serving a big crowd, you can keep the dogs warm by turning the burner to the lowest heat setting.

steps.title: Fill a microwave-safe bowl half-full with water.
steps.content: Fill a microwave-safe bowl half-full with water. Make sure the bowl is large enough to hold the number of hot dogs you want to cook. A glass or plastic microwave-safe bowl works fine. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Slit the top of the hotdogs lengthwise before putting them in the bowl.
steps.content: Slit the top of the hotdogs lengthwise before putting them in the bowl. Use a knife to make a shallow slit from one end of the hot dog to the other; this keeps the dogs from bursting in the microwave. Add the frankfurters to the bowl of water.

steps.title: Cook the hot dogs on high for 75 seconds or until they're steaming hot.
steps.content: Cook the hot dogs on high for 75 seconds or until they're steaming hot. After 75 seconds, cut the tip off a hot dog to see whether it steams. If it doesn't, continue cooking, pausing the microwave every 30 seconds to check them again. [6] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source You can also check to see if it needs more time by looking at the texture of the hot dog; if the skin looks wrinkled and darker in color, it's probably done. If you're cooking more than a few hot dogs, they will need an extra minute or two to fully heat. Hot dogs can be contaminated with Listeria after they’ve been cooked at the plant. To avoid getting sick, heat hot dogs thoroughly before eating. [7] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source

steps.title: Drain the hot dogs.
steps.content: Drain the hot dogs. Use a fork to remove them from the hot water and drain the dogs on a paper towel before serving them.

steps.title: Season the water before you boil the hot dogs.
steps.content: Season the water before you boil the hot dogs. Plain-boiled hot dogs taste great, but you might want to give yours a kick by adding some spices. Try adding 1/2 teaspoon (1.44 g) of salt if you like your hot dogs salty. In addition, pour in one or more of the following spices before you turn up the heat: 1/2 teaspoon (1.44 g) garlic powder 1/2 teaspoon (1.44 g) Italian spice mix 1/4 teaspoon (.72 g) cayenne pepper

steps.title: Pour a beer into the water.
steps.content: Pour a beer into the water. Beer imparts a delicious, mellow flavor to the hot dogs while making them a tender texture It's the perfect way to add flavor if you're cooking up a batch of dogs to eat while watching sports or serving a roomful of adults who like the flavor of beer. Replace 1 1/2 cups (360 g) of water with a can of beer. Bring it to a boil and cook the dogs as normal. [8] X Research source If you're up for an experiment, try different types of beer. For example, a pale ale will impart a very different taste than a darker beer. This method works for hot dogs of any kind, but tastes especially good with all-beef dogs.

steps.title: Add a garlic clove to the water.
steps.content: Add a garlic clove to the water. Tossing in a garlic clove or two while the water comes to a boil is a great way to add earthy flavor to your hot dogs. You don't even have to peel the garlic; just throw in a clove or two.

steps.title: Try sautéing the hot dogs after you boil them.
steps.content: Try sautéing the hot dogs after you boil them. To sauté your hot dogs , heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add a dash of olive oil. Use a knife to split your dogs in half lengthwise. When the oil is hot, sauté the dogs split-side down until they're brown and crispy.

steps.title: Dress the dogs with your favorite condiments.
steps.content: Dress the dogs with your favorite condiments. Place your dogs in their buns and add tasty toppings . No matter how you cook your dogs, the best flavor comes afterward in the form of great condiments. Here are a few ideas to get creative with your hot dogs : Chili Shredded cheese Ketchup and mustard Chopped onions, raw or sauteed Sauteed mushrooms Pickle relish
